page.title: 14Iron and honey
page.content: By Ladies Pool in Blakedown can be seen the remains of the Iron works. They were opened in 1856 by Mr Samuel Bradley of Springbrook House. His factory was mainly used for making iron axles for high class trade and these were exported as far away as Australia and the Cape. The machinery was driven by a water wheel fed by water from Ladies Pool. Incidentally there were many water mills between Blakedown and Kidderminster. The blacksmith's house is no longer standing, but the forge still exists and you can see the rings on the inside walls where they tied the horses. In 1950 a Honey Farm was set up by a Mr Bradford in Belbroughton Road. Honey was brought from nearby honey farms for processing and then sold all over the country.
